snippet.title: In Nigeria, the mass abduction of schoolgirls isn't shocking
snippet.description:
* The heavily armed militants stormed the girls dormitory in the middle of the night, herding more than 200 students on to vehicles and burning down nearby buildings as they made their escape.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/21/world/africa/nigeria-abducted-girls/index.html

snippet.title: Holograms and wearable tech: Introducing travel's sci-fi future
snippet.description:
* Ten years from now, you could be sitting at home, feeling a little burned out.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/20/travel/the-future-of-travel-reads-like-a-sci-fi-novel/index.html

snippet.title: 'Noah': Roundup of the flood of reviews
NTSB: No evidence of fire before FedEx truck crashed into students' bus
snippet.description:
* Cell phone video recorded from inside a car clipped by a FedEx tractor-trailer truck before it slammed into a bus carrying students in Northern California is being reviewed by investigators, the National Transportation Safety Board said Sunday.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/13/us/california-bus-crash/index.html

snippet.title: How 'groundbreaking' number crunching found path of Flight 370
snippet.description:
* Monday's announcement by Malaysia's Prime Minister acknowledging that missing Flight 370 ended in the southern Indian Ocean opens the door to a big question: How did new number crunching confirm the Boeing 777's path?
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/24/world/asia/malaysia-airlines-satellite-tracking/index.html

snippet.description:

http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/19/us/jewish-center-shootings-kkk-rebranding/index.html

snippet.title: Hillary Clinton's record at State under fire, again
snippet.description:
* (CNN) – The back-and-forth between Republicans and defenders of Hillary Clinton’s record as America’s top diplomat is flaring anew. On Tuesday, a reporter asked agency spokeswoman Jen Psaki to "identify one tangible achievement" from a key project...
http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/22/hillary-clintons-record-at-state-under-fire-again/

snippet.title: Inside Politics Speed Read: Sushi and robots, not sanctions and trade agreements
snippet.description:
* Sushi and robots, not sanctions and trade agreements–On President Obama’s visit to Asia, we’ve seen him eat $300 sushi, view an archery demonstration and play soccer with a robot. What we haven’t seen is any movement on a key Pacific region trade...
http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/24/inside-politics-speed-read-sushi-and-robots-not-sanctions-and-trade-agreements/

snippet.title: Inside Politics Speed Read: Good Congress, bad Congress
snippet.description:
* Good Congress, Bad Congress – You could get intellectual whiplash watching some of the campaign commercials starting to emerge from Democrats in 2014. Take Michelle Nunn, the daughter of former Georgia Sen. Sam Nunn wants her dad’s old job. She’s...
http://politicalticker.blogs.cnn.com/2014/04/23/inside-politics-speed-read-good-congress-bad-congress/

snippet.title: UNC: Experts find flaws in whistleblower's findings on literacy
snippet.description:
* The University of North Carolina says that three independent experts in the field of adult literacy have finished a university-commissioned review of whistleblower Mary Willingham's research and found flaws in her claims that some athletes were reading at elementary-school levels.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/11/us/ncaa-athletes-unc-whistleblower/index.html
